attributes.action: Recognise The Windrush Generation & make them all automatically British citizens
attributes.background: In 1948 hundreds from the Carribean answered the call from the motherland to help rebuild the UK. Many continued to arrive with their families until 1971 & under the 1948 national immigration act were automatically granted British citizenship. It's time to make all of that generation British.
attributes.additional_details: David Lammy called for recognition of the Windrush Generation & many more.

attributes.action: To make it compulsory that new drivers take a speed awareness course
attributes.background: On 22nd May 2018 my brother-in-law tragically died after road traffic accident. Ryan was on life support for 3 days when the doctors told his parents there was nothing else they could do for Ryan, the damage to his brain was so severe. This all happened because of speeding and lack of knowledge.
attributes.additional_details: I would like the government to make it compulsory that everyone after passing their practical driving test must take a speed awareness course before being allowed to drive legally on their own.

attributes.action: Allow a long term partner to be named on the death certificate
attributes.background: My partner and I have been living together for 15 years. We have been together through homelessness, the loss of a child and finally his death. We couldn’t afford to get divorced from our previous partners and so we never married. On registering his death his wife’s name was used not mine

attributes.action: Guaranteed help at A&E to prevent avoidable deaths from suicide
attributes.background: When you feel suicidal in the UK, doctors tell you to go to A&E. What you will find there is based on luck: will you find compassion? Or will you be judged and turned away? A majority of the time, the latter. Asking for help can be a turning point for individuals in crisis.
attributes.additional_details:
There should be a nation-wide, guaranteed response to individuals seeking help for suicidal thoughts and feelings in our hospitals. 
 
The following procedure should be guaranteed as a standard response: 
 
1. The contemplation of suicide or signs of severe mental distress is classified as a medical emergency. 
2. The individual is processed on-site immediately. 
3. The individual is taken to a “Calm Room”. 
4. ‘Suicide Guarantee’ trained staff member speaks with the individual with attentive compassion. 
5. A specialist professional involves the individual in creating a written plan to assure their immediate safety and ongoing treatment and/or support.

attributes.action: More Necessary Research and Funding on the NHS for Ehlers Danlos Patients.
attributes.background: Ehlers Danlos syndrome is a condition that affects the connective tissue. Several of the symptoms involve stretchy skin, severe dislocations and unusual bleeding as well as joint pain. Seven years ago I was diagnosed with Eds which is when I realised that research was limited.
attributes.additional_details: As an EDS sufferer for several years, it has become apparent that the lack of research and funding and treatments not being on the NHS is the reason that Ehlers danlos patients are treated unfairly. If we attend Accident and Emergency we should not have to explain to medical professionals what our condition is and the symptoms they should look out for and we should not have to find our own ways of treatment because the NHS lacks sufficient help.

attributes.action: Prostate cancer screening tests for men ages 18+
attributes.background:
Men tend to be less likely to check themselves than women.

A screening is less scary and embarrassing for men than visiting their GP.

Women have the tools and aid put in place to help them however men don't... why is that ?
attributes.additional_details:
Prostate cancer is the most common cancer in men.

Every 45 minutes one man dies from prostate cancer – that's more than 11,000 men every year

In the UK, about 1 in 8 men will get prostate cancer at some point in their lives.

attributes.action: Stop convicted criminals being able to change name by Deed poll.
attributes.background: This is very important. Just recently a child killer who served only 3 yrs changed his name by deed poll to hide his criminal past. No background checks are made when applying to change name by deed poll, why?
attributes.additional_details: Background checks on passports, entering Government buildings and new jobs, but we have no background checks on people wanting to change name legally, it can be done within and hour online.

attributes.action: Urge Uganda to give MP Robert Ssetamu Kyagulanyi and his comrades a fair trial.
attributes.background: Ugandan MP Robert Ssetamu Kyagulanyi aka Bobi Wine and his comrades were arrested and allegedly brutally tortured whilst supporting campaigns for an aspiring opposition MP in the northern part of Uganda. We believe this incident is in breach of commonwealth democratic values.
attributes.additional_details: We fear that he has been arrested on false charges, simply for being a successful opposition politician and we are worried he will not be given a fair trial. The UK Government should do all it can to help ensure that Robert Ssetamu Kyagulanyi and his comrades are given a fair trial.

attributes.action: Add tattoos to the protected characteristics under The Equality Act.
attributes.background: Stop discrimination towards people with tattoos by signing this petition to add tattoos to the list of protected characteristics. This would mean employers cannot force employees to cover visible tattoos, as long as these aren't deemed offensive language or to any of the 9 existing characteristics.
attributes.additional_details: 1 in 3 young adults in the UK have at least 1 tattoo today and this is still growing. Tattoos are part of different cultures throughout the world and are simply part of a person when they have them done. It is offensive and should be illegal for an employer to say to someone to cover their skin because they don’t like someone’s tattoo(s).

attributes.action: Make changes to make the theft of a dog a specific offence.
attributes.background: Dog theft is on the increase. A dog is not an object like the law considers them at the moment, the same as the treatment is different to how you would treat an object. The law needs to change in order to curb the increase in dog theft and the misery it brings to many.
attributes.additional_details: Statistics suggest that 60 dogs are stolen every week. That's 60 to many.

attributes.action: Get schools to teach life skills and how to handle emotions
attributes.background: Schools need to teach children more about how to handle their emotions. Talking to children about what to do with their feelings and how to express them without causing themselves harm. Also life skills, like managing money, building a career and learning how to start a life as an adult.
attributes.additional_details:
When leaving school, you have your grades, you have big plans about going to university and starting a life as an individual. But are schools teaching children what and where to go next? NO!
They don’t teach children what to do when they feel depressed, upset or handle their emotions. Self harm and suicide is on the rise! Schools can help this! 
They don’t teach children how to look into property and buying a house,  pay a bill and setting up direct debts. They NEED to teach life skills.

attributes.action: Introduce work-based subjects and practical skills into the schools in the UK.
attributes.background: Many children and are choosing to live a life surrounded by the streets, drugs, and murders. This stems from poor education, the education system in the UK is outdated and boring. There needs to be a change to help children, give them confidence and knowledge of work skills.
attributes.additional_details: Why are children still having to learn about the history of the Victorian times and write tons of uninteresting and difficult paperwork, when they could be learning skills of the trade? Maybe they want to be an electrician, which involves mathematical and practical skills. Introducing work-based subjects or practical skills into secondary schools will keep them interested and willing to learn rather than misbehave or drop out of school. An education system they are interested in will give them the knowledge and the confidence to leave secondary education knowing exactly what they are good at, exactly where they want to go after leaving school and are comfortable proceeding a lifelong career and keep them off the streets.

attributes.action: Consider stronger sentences for burglary offenders
attributes.background:
Currently, the crime levels of burglaries in local areas have increased dramatically.

This may range from physical attacks on residents to completely ransacking a residents house.

Those most likely to reoffend were adults serving prison sentences of less than 12 months.
attributes.additional_details:
“Statistics published by the Minstry of Justice (MoJ) reveal that more than 250,000 offences were committed by people with more than 25 previous convictions.

Those most likely to reoffend were adults serving prison sentences of less than 12 months. 

25 per cent of reoffending was due to theft, with more than 10K burglars going on to commit another 2K domestic burglaries within a year.

More than 6K serious violent offenders went on to commit more than 650 violent offences.

attributes.action: Funding for Harness Racing in the United Kingdom
attributes.background: The sport of harness racing deserves government recognition as an official sport in the United kingdon. If the rest of the world has the support and funding from the government's tben why don't we? We need the support of the government to keep our sport alive!!
attributes.additional_details:
www.bhrc.org.uk

We are a not for profit organisation  and need your support!

attributes.action: Fund a 24-hour suicide text line
attributes.background: Many people suffer from severe anxiety and may not feel comfortable making phone calls to crisis teams or suicide helplines so they avoid calling which could put them in danger. Text lines could be quicker, easier and more comfortable for younger people as well as people with severe anxiety.
attributes.additional_details: ‘The share of device owners saying they make at least one voice call a week has dropped down from 96% to 75% over the past three years, according to research carried out by Ipsos Mori for Deloitte.’ Taken from The Guardian. This shows people are using phone calls less and less so making 24 hour text lines may make more people reach it for help when they need it. Texting is quicker but it can also help people feel more comfortable with opening up so they could be more honest to get the help needed.

attributes.action: Give an income tax break for carers and nurses to promote work in healthcare
attributes.background: Raising minimum wage has not been as helpful as hoped, the problem is that when it’s raised so is the competition at local supermarkets etc. Some care homes can not afford to raise further. Giving a tax benefit to carers and nurses would encourage and reward people who work in this industry.
attributes.additional_details:
Lots of local authorities pay rates to care homes that means they struggle to break even, some have to reduce staffing numbers to compensate putting people at extreme risk. Other operators that also support people who pay privately are able to work more effectively but still have to pay the minimum wage.

We could make it policy that all carers and nurses that work under a cqc registration for care would benefit. This would have an added impact by encouraging people to leave temp agencies

attributes.action: Demand a pay cut of £13,612 of all MLAs in Northern Ireland
attributes.background: There has been deadlock in Stormont with key players obstructing negotiations since the assembly collapse. Public services are suffering due to the collapse while public servants receive full pay. This is unreasonable!
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.bbc.co.uk/news/amp/uk-northern-ireland-42418944
I z http://www.itv.com/news/utv/2018-03-13/bradley-rejects-claims-of-dithering-over-mla-pay/

attributes.action: Permit marriage outdoors without the requirement of a permanent structure
attributes.background: Permit UK citizens to marry under a non-religious legally binding ceremony, in England and Wales, in all outdoor spaces without the requirement of a physical permanent structure. Laws already exist in Scotland and Northern Island. I am calling for equality within all countries of the United Kingdom.

attributes.action: To include adult grooming in the Sexual Offences Act 2003.
attributes.background:
Age is arbitrary and anyone can be groomed. 

This could mean an elderly person, someone with a mental health condition or just someone who has their guard down. 

Let's change the legislation to help these victims and stop these heinous acts from continuing.
attributes.additional_details:
'Grooming can be defined as the process that an abuser uses to desensitise someone – to make them less like to reject or report abusive behaviour.'

https://www.survivorsuk.org/question/grooming/

Also use the site for further information.

attributes.action: Amnesty for T4 students who overstayed because of colleges closed by UK in 2014.
attributes.background: In 2014 to achieve the unrealistic target of net migration figure, the UKBA closed a large number of colleges and played with students’ future. They lost their tuition fees and many of them didn’t find a way to came out from this problem.
attributes.additional_details: Young people especially the students are the backbone of every economy in the world. Most of the overstayed students are good at English and are working part-time as well, to support themselves and the UK economy by paying taxes. They are just the victims of unrealistic Home Office targets. Many of them are now working in low paid jobs and the businesses are just abusing and exploiting them. Giving them amnesty will bring them into the taxpayer net, and yield millions of pounds in tax and national insurance and they will contribute to the UK economy.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory to give your details if reporting someone to the DWP
attributes.background:
It should be made compulsory to have to give your details when reporting someone to the National Benefit Fraud hotline. 
Name , Address & telephone number should be given at all times . 
Making false accusations against someone is happening constantly & needs to be stopped.

attributes.action: Keep the A422 through Farthinghoe closed and build a sensible bypass instead.
attributes.background: The recent road closure at Farthinghoe provides the occasion to finally address the problem of heavy traffic passing dangerously through this lovely village.
attributes.additional_details:
Farthinghoe has been in need of a bypass for more than 20 years but the funds and political will have not been available.

Last year there was a consultation and a route chosen.

It isn't sensible to spend money re-opening a road which isn't fit for purpose. Public funds should be spent instead on creating a safe and sustainable solution in the form of a bypass.

The road passes within feet of Farthinghoe village primary school and the children are much safer thanks to the closure.

attributes.action: Referendum to join the EU on the 30th of March 2019
attributes.background:
The UK is leaving the EU on the 29th of March 2019. There will be no second referendum for leaving the EU. The applicant accepts this.

However, the applicant strongly believes that there should be a referendum for joining the EU again on the 30th of March 2019.
attributes.additional_details:
The 2016 referendum was overshadowed by misinformation from both sides, scaremongering and possibly foreign interference. 

The voters did not fully understand what the EU is or the impact on their lives and the UK as a whole. 

This petition is no attempt to change the fact that the UK is leaving the EU.

However, and in the name of democracy, the voters should enjoy a referendum to decide if the UK should join the EU again after the 29th of March 2019.

For Queen & Country,

attributes.action: Establish sepsis as a medical emergency and a priority for the NHS
attributes.background:
The recent surge of sepsis related deaths in the UK, including of my own grandmother, needs to be addressed before more people are lost unnecessarily to the infection. 

Many are dying from sepsis but of these only around 40% of death certificates state sepsis as cause of death.
attributes.additional_details:
Sepsis kills more than 44,000 people a year in the UK alone. This is more than breast, bowel and prostate cancer combined.

Despite these alarming statistics many don’t know about the implications and seriousness of the infection, which leads to an increase in blood pressure and multiple organ failure.

The amount of people with sepsis has increased by over a third from 2015 to 2017, showing this is an ever increasing problem which needs to be addressed as soon as possible.

attributes.action: Government: honour your manifesto pledge to plant 11m trees by 2020
attributes.background: You won the election with a promise to plant 11million trees by 2020. You must action this and report bi-annually on progress with measures in place to ensure this is met.
attributes.additional_details: Governments must honour their manifesto pledges. Climate change is upon us and biodiversity loss is unprecedented. This government must be held to account on environmental protection & lack of tangible action on their tree planting pledge. Trees take years to grow, they need a management plan and funds to support their maturation. The Government should deliver their promise on time or provide funding to ensure that a suitable charity can take ownership of this action.

attributes.action: Legislate to make all sewage treatment plants into biomass digesters.
attributes.background: IThis has a number of benefits. Capping the tanks where the solid waste is digested would mean that less smell and methane (one of the worst greenhouse gases) is released into the atmosphere.  Instead it would be fed into the gas network reducing our reliance on imported or fracked gas.
attributes.additional_details: Raw sewage is also sprayed onto fields.  It still smells and is still releasing methane.  It is easily washed out and pollutes water and it has less benefit for the soil.  Processed sewage is drier and more composted.  There is little methane and and nutrients are locked inand are not so easily washed out therefore it feeds and conditions the soil. It can also be used all year round and not just on empty fields.

attributes.action: Stop arms deals with Saudi Arabia in light of Kashoggi and actions in Yemen.
attributes.background: The U.N has written a damning report of Saudi Arabia's actions in Yemen. Stating “There is little evidence of any attempt by parties to the conflict to minimize civilian casualties.” And also in light of the possible assassination of the journalist Jamal Kashoggi.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theguardian.com/world/2018/aug/28/all-sides-in-yemen-may-be-responsible-for-war-crimes-say-un-experts

attributes.action: Increase the budget for Sussex Police to effectively protect the public
attributes.background: Over the past twenty years, operational police presence in Sussex has been reduced to dangerous levels. A lack of warranted officers is resulting in too many documented cases where there has been a lack of e police response leading to an increased the risk to public safety.
attributes.additional_details: As a former Sussex Police officer who was deployed as a urban and rural unformed officer and Detective, I am deeply concerned that Sussex Police is becoming more isolated and detached from the public it serves. Online referrals are no effective substitute for face to face engagement and the Government and local authority should recognise and react to the severe budgetary restraints that are causing the loss of public confidence in the counties police service.

attributes.action: Improve the transition from mental health child service to adult
attributes.background: As it stands the mental health services in the UK discharge young people at the age of 18 and in some cases even 17 and move them onto the adult services. This process is in most cases tricky and many get lost in the system. The system needs a change to help the people who need it.

attributes.action: require proactive cleansing of our sewers under section 94 of the water act 1991
attributes.background: Currently the countries sewers are not being inspected for 40 plus years leading to fat bergs blockages and restricted flows. Reactive cleaning after blockages is detrimental to our infrastructures ability to cope with additional housing
attributes.additional_details: Ofwat have stated it is acceptable for manholes not to be lifted for 40 plus years meaning no maintenance cleansing or attempt to keep flowing of our sewers. This leads to serious blockages and fat bergs - syphons need inspecting every two years pipework cleaning ever 8 to 10 years - this policy is detrimental to public health and is fundamentally irrational interpretation of the law, simple because no time limit to cleaning is present within the state this does not mean it removes common sense.

attributes.action: Pay nursing students whilst on placement in University
attributes.background: Nursing students whilst in University work full time with the NHS. For some people, the money that they get from the NHS and their loan isn’t even enough to cover their rent and living costs.
attributes.additional_details: A lot of student nurses get depressed, anxiety and are over tired because they put so much hard work into their nursing degrees especially from all the placements including night shifts. A lot more get stressed because they physically can’t afford to live due to overpriced student housing and then money to live off for the whole year. There is also transport to think about for nurses going to placement. Student nurses feel like they’re ‘cheap labour’ for the NHS which is awful and upsetting.

attributes.action: Develop an Isle Of Wight Airport for potential Commercial Airline use
attributes.background:
The Isle Of Wight is in the unfortunate position of having very expensive and unreliable ferries as the only way to get to and from it at present.
This is why it really needs a developed airport to be served by Ryanair, Easyjet etc to give everyone another option to get to and from the Island.
attributes.additional_details:
The Channel Islands which are smaller and have fewer events and far fewer tourists have the option of flights or ferries.

The Isle Of Skye has a fixed link or ferries as options.
It really doesn't feel that the Isle Of Wight's population or visitors are given the support that the aforementioned Islands receive with regards to options of transport to and from the Island at a fair price. We are held to ransom by the ferry companies as that's the only option we have available to us.

attributes.action: Amend s.76 Serious Crime Act 2015 (Parental Alienation amendment)
attributes.background: Parental Alienation is a psychological crime against former partners and children, yet is largely ignored by the Police and Courts. Amend s.76 SCA 2015 to specifically make Parental Alienation a "domestic Abuse" crime. This is child abuse as well as parent abuse and it must stop.
attributes.additional_details: The Courts, CAFCASS, Social Services and the Police treat domestic violence as a crime against women, yet up to 1200 men take their lives each year because the system blocks them from their children. Whilst this may seem like a crime against an adult, it is actually child abuse. Reports in numerous countries demonstrate how damaging this is to children and yet the UK Government ignores the issue. One suicide is too many, but over 1000 annually is a national disgrace.

attributes.action: Repeal the EU Copyright Directive, when the UK leaves the EU.
attributes.background: The EU has just passed, Articles 11 and 13 of the EU Copyright Directive. This could damage and threaten people's right to freedom of speech and expression online, fair use and censor political and peaceful conversation. This should be repealed from UK law on the UK's exit from the EU.

attributes.action: Make DLA/ PIP assessment companies liable for wrongly rejected claims
attributes.background: Countless disabled and individuals severely in need are not being awarded what they are rightly entitled to. Furthermore, those already in recipient of DLA/PIP are having their awards completely taken away. Companies must be fined when appeals succeed to make them assess claims properly.
attributes.additional_details: Daily, there are numerous reports of wrongly rejected claims. These awards are often taken away or not awarded at all because PIP assessment companies don’t take their responsibilities seriously. Reports are showing consistent similarities - What a claimant has said and what a medical professional who knows them personally, is not being taken into account. In addition to this, assessors are writing claimants have shown examples of doing things that contradicts the truth entirely.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for online platforms to allow sales of CITES-protected species
attributes.background: While it's illegal to buy and sell seahorses (dead, alive, whole or in part) within Europe, online platforms flout this law by hosting adverts for their sale. Seahorses could therefore be functionally extinct in 25 - 30 years* (based on 150 million + seahorses per year taken from the sea).
attributes.additional_details:
Ref: * figures from SaveourSeahorses
 
The Seahorse Trust (www.theseahorsetrust.org) has campaigned and highlighted to each online marketplace over the last twelve + months the illegality of sales of CITES-protected seahorses, but is continually ignored. It should be illegal for these adverts to be hosted by online marketplaces.

attributes.action: Criminalise chatting to children online even if the chat isn't sexual.
attributes.background: We believe it should be an offence (when the child and adult do not know each other "offline" - in real life) to chat to a child under the age of 16 online, whether actual sexual grooming takes place or not.
attributes.additional_details: Children can still be manipulated into meeting with an adult whose true intentions to sexually abuse the victim are never revealed in chat. Indeed cases just like this do happen when nothing remotely sexual has been discussed in chat yet the intention to facilitate the meet is still the aim by the predator who has then gone on to abuse the child.

attributes.action: Require and fund access for disabled witnesses in all courts.
attributes.background: Disabled people should have access to all courts in the UK which should comply with The Equality Act 2010. Courts have a duty to make these adjustments ,removing barriers restricting the access that prevents people with disabilities being able to attend court, however this isn’t always the case.
attributes.additional_details:
People with disabilities have the same rights as able bodied people, and should receive the same level of service. If these measures are not put in place, this should be known as unlawful discrimination. This prevents people with disabilities from continuing with the criminal justice system. This should be implemented for both the witness and the defendant. 
Ramp access through the entire court should be standard. 
I could not access the witness door because it had a step, this led me to, “bump” into my abuser. I had to sit very close to him with a screen but could still hear his breath as I was answering questions.

attributes.action: Raise minimum wage for 16 year olds to £5 an hour
attributes.background: Minors work just as well as young adults, so why is there such a large difference between wages? This is unfair because many minors struggle to support themselves and they want to become more independent but cannot because they are constantly relying on their parents to provide them with money.
attributes.additional_details: Please sign this petition for minors everywhere.

attributes.action: Require that cities allow camping on public property and provide 24 hour toilets
attributes.background: In the UK homeless individuals are often harassed, disturbed and ticketed for temporary encampments on public property. The Vagrancy act 1824 is used to criminalize the very condition of being without a house. Public Space Protection Orders are used by Councils to harass rough sleepers.
attributes.additional_details: Camping is a necessary survival activity for homeless individuals, and must be allowed until all rough sleepers are immediately sheltered. The UK must pass meaningful legislation to insure the homeless have a right to secure their physical well being. We must abolish UK laws or ordinances that prohibit public camping, or criminalise life-sustaining activity. We must also require UK cities with large homeless populations to provide public, 24 hour sanitary facilities such as portable toilets.

attributes.action: Each child receiving high rate DLA should have a ECHP when they turn 3
attributes.background: I thought my son would go to mainstream school, I was wrong. If the EHCP was a procedure that was required to happen, he would not be without a school. Most high rate DLA children cannot cope in a mainstream school. This needs to be in place to give parents the options that’s right for their child.
attributes.additional_details: I have waited 31 weeks and still have no place as I was not given enough guidance. This is a process most will only go through once. Let’s make it easier to get a child into the right school. Inclusion, not exclusion. No mainstream school could cater for my son. Many children are placed in the wrong provisions to make the numbers match. It’s time this changed and this process is looked at.

attributes.action: Create a permit system for  garden fireworks and when they can be used.
attributes.background: I would like to request request the introduction of a permit system for use of fireworks in domestic situations.  A total ban is unfair on the many sensible users, but he affect on animals, domestic and wild, and vulnerable people is now greater than be considered fair.
attributes.additional_details:
The modern "firework season" lasts for a week or more. What constitutes a domestic firework has changed drastically with many being what would previously have been considered display fireworks.  Therefore I would like to request;

1) A permit system for domestic firework displays 

2) Home firework displays limited to certain times  on bonfire weekend & New Year's eve.

3) Stricter controls on fireworks for sale to the general public.

4) Increase legal age for the purchase of fireworks to 25.

attributes.action: The UK should create a Blockchain Act to support the new tokenized economy
attributes.background: Our legal infrastructure needs to provide a foundation for proper digital signing with private keys, and support the legal consequences of the ownership, possession and transfer of tokens.
attributes.additional_details:
A Blockchain Act will support the new tokenized economy, and where real-world applications around blockchain can be enacted with legal certainty. These tokens include: payment tokens (currency coins); utility tokens (services); and security tokens (equity and assets). 

Liechtenstein's Blockchain Act defines its objective as to:

"enable the transformation of the ‘real’ world to blockchain systems while ensuring legal certainty, thereby opening up the full application potential of the token economy."

The UK Act should aim to define “legal certainty” for blockchain implementation and projects, and define a world where our existing assets are added onto blockchain, and then traded there.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on England leaving the United Kingdom.
attributes.background: The Scottish have had the chance to vote for independence, it’s about time the English had the same right.

attributes.action: Require free water bottle refilling stations across UK service stations
attributes.background: The price of bottled water is extortionate in service stations across the UK (in some places beer is cheaper). This means people are penalised for needing an essential fuel of life, and adds to the plastic waste issue epidemic.
attributes.additional_details: Water bottle refilling stations would help cut down our plastic waste, promote a healthier lifestyle, and cut out the unnecessarily high price for bottled water in service stations, all at a low cost to the tax payer. This could be paired with cardboard cups and recycling bins for those wishing to have a quick drink on the go.

attributes.action: The UK government should allow Steve Bannon to enter the UK
attributes.background: Steve Bannon is not a far-right political figure he is just plain and simple Right.  To say he poses a risk to the security of the UK is absurd. He should be allowed to enter the UK and give a strong alternative view to the liberal left we have here.

attributes.action: Give the electorate a Referendum to make House of Lords wholly elected via PR
attributes.background: The House of Lords membership criteria belongs to previous centuries, the UK  electorate deserves a wholly elected 2nd Chamber. Elected using solely proportional representation as a method of checks & balances.

attributes.action: Require cases of controlling & coercive behaviour to be heard by trained judges
attributes.background: The standard jury system cannot understand or deal appropriately with perpetrators of psychological abuse. These cases must be exempt from a jury and heard by a judge with specialist psychology level trained to understand narcistic traits of controlling and coercive behaviour in all relationships.
attributes.additional_details: This crime is mind torture as the perpetrator isolates and abuses their victim to the extreme in a calculated way so they are trapped completely. This is not seen by anyone and the evidence is minimal for conviction with a public jury. Perpetrators will not leave their victims alone. They cover up so well and you are made to look crazy. You get Stockholm syndrome, PTSD and ill. However many times you flee, they can find you, they know exactly what they are doing.

attributes.action: Make Makaton/BSL part of the national curriculum at Early Years Level.
attributes.background: Communication is an ESSENTIAL life skill. Much of everyday life relies on it, from playing to learning, to getting our needs met. Makaton is a language programme using signs and symbols to aid communication and designed to support the spoken language.
attributes.additional_details: My son is 5 years old, just started year 1 mainstream primary school and has a diagnosis of non verbal autism with learning difficulties. His needs are not deemed enough for an additional needs school yet he is unable to communicate with his peers and teachers. If makaton or BSL were taught in the early years my son would now be able to communicate his needs, communicate with his friends and show his teachers how much he understands of the curriculum he is being taught. Please help us 10,000 signatures is all we need in order to give him a voice!

attributes.action: Offer a catchup HPV vaccine programme to women aged 18-26 on the NHS
attributes.background:
- Many women missed the HPV vaccine while at school due to parental abstention or missed appointments.
- The HPV vaccine is currently only available to women on the NHS up until age 18
- The vaccine retails at £450 at high-street pharmacies - utterly unaffordable for most.
attributes.additional_details:
NHS vaccine guidelines - https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/vaccinations/hpv-human-papillomavirus-vaccine/

3100 cases of cervical cancer are diagnosed in the UK each year - almost ALL are related to HPV - https://www.cancerresearchuk.org/about-cancer/cervical-cancer

It's utterly unacceptable that girls and women who were opted out by their parents while at school are unable to catch up when they hit the age of medical consent. Providing the vaccine as a catchup will save lives, and save NHS money.
